Undercover but never unmasked: The untold story of a KGB spy in France
description: Following archival research and interviews with witnesses, Le Monde pieced together the completely unknown story of 'Lydia Tows,' a Russian agent who died in Paris in 1999. Working in tandem with a French police officer, she carried out a decades-long infiltration mission with devastating consequences.

headline: Charlie Kirk shooting: What we know about Tyler Robinson, the suspect arrested on Friday
Fitch downgrades France's credit rating
Israeli intelligence admits Iran's nuclear program has not been destroyed
description: Israeli officials have recently provided French authorities with their own assessment of the airstrikes that targeted Tehran's nuclear arsenal in June. This information is particularly valuable to France after American intelligence agencies have halted all cooperation with their European partners regarding the Iranian nuclear program.

headline: Nigerian billionaire Aliko Dangote, Africa's wealthiest man, to build one of the continent's largest fertilizer plants in Ethiopia
description: For Ethiopia, where agriculture is vital, the new plant is set to improve food security and the country's balance of payments.

headline: 'They want us to be big but without any fat': Plus-size models face return of thinness in the fashion industry
description: Their names are Sané, Camille, and Doralyse. They are plus-size models who broke into the fashion industry when inclusivity was on the rise. Today, they are considering working abroad – or even changing careers altogether.

headline: Wine clubs are discreetly shaping France's wine culture
description: Thousands of enthusiasts gather in associations or informal groups, whether at home or in bars, for themed tastings – some highly structured. The values of sharing and passing on knowledge drive these get-togethers.

In devastated Kathmandu, young Nepalese fear old leaders' return
description: No seat of power was spared in Nepal's capital during two days of unprecedented protest. The army, which has seized control of the country, is negotiating a way out of the crisis after the prime minister resigned and the president disappeared. Yet the young people behind the movement have little say in what comes next.

headline: Paris's Notre-Dame breaks attendance records nine months after reopening
description: Notre-Dame is now the most visited monument in France. Projections anticipate a total of 12 million to 13 million visitors by December 8, one year after reopening.

headline: From a Thai holiday to a Turkish prison: How two women were trapped by drug traffickers
description: The two 20-year-old women from the Paris region enjoyed an all-expenses-paid holiday in Thailand, then given suitcases packed with cannabis before their flight home. Their lawyers argued it was a case of 'great naivety.'
